llama2-70b_direct_sole-planning_results:
Day 1 (March 8th): Albuquerque to San Antonio

* Depart from Albuquerque in the morning and drive to San Antonio, Texas (approximately 7-8 hours, depending on traffic).
* Check-in at a smoking-friendly hotel such as the La Quinta Inn & Suites San Antonio Downtown or the Red Roof Inn San Antonio Downtown.
* Spend the afternoon exploring the city's famous River Walk, visiting landmarks like the Alamo and the Tower of the Americas.
* In the evening, enjoy a traditional Tex-Mex dinner at a local restaurant such as Fogo de Chão or Iron Cactus Mexican Grill & Margarita Bar.

Day 2 (March 9th): San Antonio

* Start the day with a visit to the San Antonio Missions National Historical Park, a collection of four Spanish colonial missions.
* In the afternoon, head to the Pearl District and explore the local shops and restaurants.
* End the day with a stroll along the River Walk and enjoy some live music at one of the many bars or clubs in the area.

Day 3 (March 10th): San Antonio to Dallas

* Depart from San Antonio in the morning and drive to Dallas, Texas (approximately 4-5 hours, depending on traffic).
* Check-in at a smoking-friendly hotel such as the La Quinta Inn & Suites Dallas Downtown or the Red Roof Inn Dallas.
* Spend the afternoon visiting local attractions like the Sixth Floor Museum at Dealey Plaza, the Dallas Arboretum and Botanical Garden, or the Perot Museum of Nature and Science.
* In the evening, head to the Deep Ellum neighborhood for dinner and drinks at one of the many restaurants and bars in the area.

Day 4 (March 11th): Dallas

* Start the day with a visit to the AT&T Stadium, home of the Dallas Cowboys football team.
* In the afternoon, head to the Galleria Mall for some shopping and dining options.
* End the day with a visit to the Reunion Tower for panoramic views of the city.

Day 5 (March 12th): Dallas to Albuquerque

* Depart from Dallas in the morning and drive back to Albuquerque, New Mexico (approximately 9-10 hours, depending on traffic).
* Stop for lunch and sightseeing in Lubbock, Texas, along the way.
* Arrive in Albuquerque in the evening and check-in at a smoking-friendly hotel such as the La Quinta Inn & Suites Albuquerque Downtown or the Red Roof Inn Albuquerque.

Day 6 (March 13th): Albuquerque

* Spend the day exploring local attractions in Albuquerque, such as the Sandia Peak Tramway, the Albuquerque BioPark Zoo, or the New Mexico Museum of Natural History and Science.
* In the evening, head to the Old Town Albuquerque for dinner and drinks at one of the many restaurants and bars in the area.

Day 7 (March 14th): Departure from Albuquerque

* Spend the morning shopping for souvenirs or visiting any last-minute attractions in Albuquerque.
* Depart for the airport and fly back home.

Budget Breakdown:

* Accommodation (7 nights): $1,400
* Transportation (car rental and fuel): $1,200
* Food and dining: $1,800
* Attractions and activities: $600
* Miscellaneous expenses (souvenirs, tips, etc.): $200
Total budget: $5,000

This itinerary should provide a great balance of culture, history, and entertainment for your 7-day trip to Texas. Remember to book your accommodations and car rental in advance to ensure availability and the best rates. Additionally, be sure to check the smoking policies at each hotel before finalizing your reservations.
